text.value: Let the projectile be launched with an initial velocity v_0 which can be expressed as the sum of horizontal and vertical components as follows:

leaves.text: Let the projectile be launched with an initial velocity v_0 which can be expressed as the sum of horizontal and vertical components as follows:

text.value: The components x_{0_x} and v_{0_y} can be found if the initial launch angle, \theta, is known:

leaves.text: The components x_{0_x} and v_{0_y} can be found if the initial launch angle, \theta, is known:

text.value: See also the section Parabolic equation for information on finding the initial velocity.

leaves.text: See also the section Parabolic equation for information on finding the initial velocity.

text.value: In projectile motion, the horizontal motion and the vertical motion are independent of each other; that is, neither motion affects the other. This is the principle of compound motion established by Galileo in 1638.

leaves.text: In projectile motion, the horizontal motion and the vertical motion are independent of each other; that is, neither motion affects the other. This is the principle of compound motion established by Galileo in 1638.
